meanings.definition: To make less visible or unclear.

meanings.definition: Someone or something that makes something less clear or visible.
meanings.sent1: The tree branches acted as an obscurer, blocking the streetlight.
meanings.sent2: The mystery novel's obscurer kept readers guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat became an obscurer during the game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog was an obscurer, hiding the approaching ship from view.
meanings.sent5: The magician's assistant was an obscurer, diverting attention away from his sleight of hand tricks.
